meanings.definition: Gunges (verb): to move slowly and awkwardly
meanings.sent1: She gunges along the path, taking small steps.
meanings.sent2: The old turtle gunges across the sandy beach.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat gunges its way to its cozy bed.
meanings.sent4: Time gunges forward like a sluggish river.
meanings.sent5: The snail gunges its way up the leaf, leaving a shiny trail behind.

meanings.definition: Gunges (noun): a sticky or messy substance
meanings.sent1: The chef added a dollop of gunges to the cake batter.
meanings.sent2: The children played with colorful gunges in the art class.
meanings.sent3: The spilled gunges made the floor slippery and fun to slide on.
meanings.sent4: The gunges on the tree bark looked like melted candy.
meanings.sent5: The swamp was filled with dark, thick gunges that bubbled softly.

meanings.definition: Gunges (adjective): sticky or messy in nature
meanings.sent1: Her hands were covered in gunges after playing in the mud.
meanings.sent2: The gunges paint was difficult to wash off the walls.
meanings.sent3: The gunges glue held the pieces together firmly.
meanings.sent4: The gunges texture of the slime was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent5: The gunges jam oozed out of the sandwich, making it deliciously messy.
